comment.author: 31846825@N04
comment._content: Anybody out there know the make and model of this car? We assume it was new in 1957...
comment.authorname: State Library and Archives of Florida

comment.author: 48094458@N00
comment._content: British Ford Anglia 100E.  They used the name on different models.  Conventional to the point of being antiquated.  Cheap to make, cheap to sell, soon forgotten.

comment.author: 63121350@N00
comment._content: Huh, I didn't know they'd made left-hand-drive export models.

comment.author: 30738986@N06
comment._content: 1172cc side valve (flat head) motor, 3 speed manual gearbox (drove like a 4 speed with 3rd gear missing), vacuum windscreen wipers - we had some great cars in Britain!
